thread.title: This haunted house makes you sign a waiver to go inside
thread.title_full: This haunted house makes you sign a waiver to go inside

author: Deccan
title: This haunted house makes you sign a waiver to go inside
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 12, 2015, 16.21 pm If you get your thrills by exploring all things scary, we dare you to try out The 17 th Door, in Tustin, California. The place is deemed so scary that they make you sign a waiver acknowledging the risks and that the venue is not responsible for anything that may happen to you.
The place is based on the nightmares of a fictitious college teen named Paula and definitely lives up to its name if reports are to be believed. In fact, the place has actors that will grab you, touch you, and fall from the ceilings with other objects and you may even experience eerie smells, reports Unilad .
However, if you are too terrified to last through the spine-chilling 32 minute experience, you can scream out the safe-word ‘mercy’ and get free.
